result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew L. Rowin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All unpaid Court ordered financial obligations shall convert to civil judgment upon revocation or discharge from probation and Probation Agent shall advise the court of amounts due and owing prior to revocation or discharge.
Defendant shall be gainfully employed,seek employment or continue his/her education for the purpose of future employment.
Defendant shall submit to and comply with any evaluation, assessment, counselling and/or treatment, as deemed appropriate by Probation Agent and shall pay all applicable costs of same

Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicants or, unless modified by Probation Agent, shall not enter upon the premises of any business serving intoxicating beverages except as necessary for employment purposes.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall comply with any order in place from Health and Human Services. 
Early discharge from probation shall be at Agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
